attributes.action: make it a true DEMOCRACY in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Petition for a DEMOCRACY in the UK:

upon reading that a certain Birmingham venue is under pressure following ONE complaint, which makes me recall hearing about a few adverts were cancelled due to a simlar amount of complaints - wouldnt it be nice to actually listen to what the majority want instead of the minorty - FOR ONCE??

Lets listen to the people and let things like this be subject to a vote - if 10000 people love a venue and one person complains surely its only fair that majority opinion is correct in a democracy? and if 10,000,000 people love an advert and 3 people complain surely in a democracy the opinion of the majority should matter?

Adverts and venues are not the only things in the firing line of the "Minority"

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
